title: Ticket #7393: Build using platform build tools on Jessie (Debian 8)
description: The Debian 8 package build uses different scripts than all the other Debian/Ubuntu builds. Let's me them the same.
remarks:
2019-Dec-04 17:00:22 by tlmiller:
Code Review

Looks good to me. The other platforms mentioned we either no longer build (so yay for getting rid of it), or using what is now the only build method (so yay for getting rid of it).

2019-Dec-04 17:01:42 by tlmiller:
Unless the upgrade from the previous version is clean, this probably merits a release note of some sort.

2019-Dec-24 07:03:42 by tim:
For some reason, apt can't automatically handle the classad library moving out of the condor package into its own. You can force the update and everything turns out OK. However, as such, it is not appropriate for a stable release. So, I am partially reverting this change. We will not build with native tools. We will add the build dependency so that out side people can build with native tools.

2019-Dec-24 07:04:16 by tim:
No docs needed, no user visible changes.
